31).
• Try not to restrict your diet 
unless you think a food 
is upsetting your baby. 
Always talk to your health 
visitor or doctor before 
cutting out foods.
• Keep your alcohol intake 
low. Alcohol in breastmilk 
can	affect	your	baby’s	
feeding or sleeping. Avoid 
drinking alcohol shortly 
before feeding your baby.
• Avoid drinking too much 
strong	tea	or	coffee.
Peanuts
Peanuts are one of the most 
common causes of food allergy. 
Peanut	allergy	affects	about	1%	
of people and can cause seve
